input: Bob is smart. Charlie is big. Charlie is rough. Dave is big. Dave is furry. Dave is rough. Dave is young. Harry is blue. Harry is furry. Harry is red. Harry is rough. Harry is smart. All smart, red people are big. If someone is rough and blue then they are red. If someone is smart then they are furry. Big people are rough. If someone is furry then they are blue. If Bob is blue then Bob is red. Question: Bob is not rough.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Bob : obj
constant Charlie : obj
constant Dave : obj
constant Harry : obj

constant Smart : obj → Prop
constant Big : obj → Prop
constant Rough : obj → Prop
constant Furry : obj → Prop
constant Young : obj → Prop
constant Blue : obj → Prop
constant Red : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Smart Bob
axiom T2 : Big Charlie
axiom T3 : Rough Charlie
axiom T4 : Big Dave
axiom T5 : Furry Dave
axiom T6 : Rough Dave
axiom T7 : Young Dave
axiom T8 : Blue Harry
axiom T9 : Furry Harry
axiom T10 : Red Harry
axiom T11 : Rough Harry
axiom T12 : Smart Harry

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Smart x ∧ Red x → Big x
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Rough x ∧ Blue x → Red x
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Smart x → Furry x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Big x → Rough x
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x → Blue x
axiom R6 : Blue Bob → Red Bob

theorem bob_is_not_rough : ¬ Rough Bob :=
begin
  intro H,
  have H1 : Red Bob := R2 Bob ⟨H, R5 Bob (R3 Bob T1)⟩,
  have H2 : Big Bob := R1 Bob ⟨T1, H1⟩,
  have H3 : Rough Bob := R4 Bob H2,
  contradiction,
end

-- The answer is True
